Even did some video editing after capturing some video and taking pictures. I’m sure I can improve the life once the novelty of it goes away and I don’t turn it on unnecessarily. LoL As always its way faster and the screen looks amazing in any light. Though a little heavier than any phone I’ve used, the Midnight Green looks awesome in my opinion. As to why I like using an iPhone, I know there are lots of choices running Android but the simplicity of taking pics and video, editing them and syncing them across my devices and posting them while on the move are key for me. So, that’s my take on the iPhone 11 Pro Max after the last 4 days.

Heading: Amazing Camera & Battery
Text:
So, at this point if you are not familiar with iOS and what iPhones are all about here comes a short summary. Apple iPhones are normally great hardware, build quality, and easy UI. Unlike Android, normally you don’t hear spec sheets on iPhone. RAM, battery size, processors are usually a mute point because they iPhone run iOS which can’t really compared to Android. Don’t get me wrong I’ve used many, many Android phones (most recently the Samsung Note 10+) and they have some amazing phones, with equally amazing cameras, and features. 

So, what sets this iPhone apart from the ones that have come before, even the XS, is the cameras are a huge step forward, and they battery is hard to kill. Most phones take great photos in optimal lighting conditions. What sets phones apart is how they handle low light, or night photography. Here is where this iPhone really shines. The images that this device is able to capture with little light is amazing. With Deep Fusion around the corner, you will also see an increase in detail in most photos that don’t use the Night shot mode or HDR. The battery holds up amazingly well. Even after a day of heavy usage, screen on over 8 hours I am able to end the day around 20-30% easily. I usually unplug around 6am and plug it back in around 10-11pm. Never do I feel like I need to top off the battery for fear of not making it through the day.

Everything else on the phone is still great, but not what I would consider a huge step up from previous models. Screen looks amazing, super bright in direct sunlight, Speakers are great, sometimes I forgo my Bluetooth speaker and just use the phones speakers. The matte glass back feels great, but most people won’t see it since most cover it up with a case to protect this investment. 

I would definitely recommend this to anyone, especially those already locked in to the Apple ecosystem. Apple’s iOS 13 is great, and offers some great features, but that isn’t specific to this phone so go and upgrade your old device first to see what you are getting here. I am very happy with my upgrade.

Heading: Stellar phone

Here are some things that I’ve noticed that aren’t necessarily bad, but might bother others:
- while the triple lenses are nice, picture quality still sucks. I will say that wide angle lens is awesome tho.
- night mode in the camera settings cannot stay permanently off. It’s great for light absorption in dark situations (similar to a long shutter speed on a dslr), but waiting 1-3 seconds for the picture to process is quite annoying. Especially when you either wanted a dark picture, or have subjects that can’t sit still. You can tap the night mode icon and slide the timer to off, but this must be done every time it detects inadequate light. 
- it’s heavy! Maybe because I came from the 8 & X, but still, for a phone, it’s quite the dense rock lol.
- the screen is “tall”; the Max models are larger In general, but compared to previous Plus models that had top & bottom caption-style hardware/home buttons, this one is pretty long compared to its lack of wideness. If you one-hand operate a lot, I’d recommend playing in many different apps to get a feel for how far you’ll have to stretch lol.
- the flashlight gives a pinkish hue.. unimportant I’m sure, but it’s also not as bright. 
Overall a great device and I would absolutely purchase again!
